data.title: Demo Series: Move Your Supply Chain Forward
data.text:
Leverage Suppliers to Accelerate Product Innovation

October 6, 2021

Overview

Title: Leverage Suppliers to Accelerate Product Innovation

Date: October 6, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

As procurement continues to play a strategic role in product innovation, supplier collaboration is key to your ability to drive cost savings, reduce risk, identify new opportunities, and accelerate time to market. But how can you source the best partners? How can you collaborate and integrate them within your product lifecycle? With an end-to-end procurement solution that automates and standardizes your sourcing activities, enables collaboration, and integrates suppliers within your innovation processes. See ours in action.

Speaker

Ana Galindo

Senior SCM Product Marketing Manager

Ana Galindo is a SCM Product Marketing Manager with over 4 years of experience in the Supply Chain space. She is currently responsible for the marketing of the Cloud Procurement solutions at Oracle. Prior to her time at Oracle, Ana worked at Elementum, a supply chain software company, as part of their demand generation team. Ana holds a Bachelor’s of Science in Business Administration, with a concentration in Marketing from San Jose State University.

Linkedin Ana Galindo

Planning for Product Innovation Success

September 15, 2021

Overview

Title: Planning for Product Innovation Success

Date: September 15, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

Responding quickly and accurately to demand fluctuations is a must. Supply chain planning systems not only help navigate future uncertainty, but they also serve as systems of record for key details of your products’ sales, distribution, manufacturing, and sourcing. Join this demo to see how you can tap into planning data to support key decisions in your product innovation strategy.

Speakers

Tom McDonough

Senior Director of Product Marketing

Tom has worked in supply chain management for over 25 years, leading supply chain functions in the high tech industry at Technicolor and Intel and supply chain consulting services in media & communications, consumer goods and retail industries.

Linkedin Tom McDonough

Warren Basch

Distinguished Sales Consultant at Oracle

Darren is a SCM professional with over 10 years of experience helping companies with their new product introduction and product development processes. He has a background in mechanical engineering and focuses on helping companies drive transformation through analytics and emerging technology.

Linkedin Warren Basch

Turn Your Best Ideas Into Valuable Innovations

September 1, 2021

Overview

Title: Turn Your Best Ideas Into Valuable Product Innovations

Date: September 1, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

There’s no shortage of product ideas these days. How can you feed your innovation pipeline with only the best ideas—ideas that are achievable, exceed customer expectations, and align to your growth strategy? With a unified cloud solution, you can leverage analytics and IoT data to turn your ideas and customer requirements into profitable new products and services. See ours in action.

Speakers

Kirk Carlsen

Director, PLM Product Marketing

Kirk Carlsen is a Product Marketing Director for Product Lifecycle Management applications at Oracle. Kirk helps customers understand how they can successfully meet customer expectations with digitally transformative technologies that help drive product innovation and streamline commercialization.

Linkedin Kirk Carlsen

Darren Conrad

Master Principal Solution Consultant

Darren is a SCM professional with over 10 years of experience helping companies with their new product introduction and product development processes. He has a background in mechanical engineering and focuses on helping companies drive transformation through analytics and emerging technology.

Linkedin Darren Conrad

Accelerate Product and Service Innovation

April 28, 2021

Overview

Title: Accelerate Product and Service Innovation

Date: April 28, 2021

Description

Are you able innovate and launch new products and services fast? Can you shift your business model to deliver new experiences that customers want? In this demo, you'll learn how Oracle Cloud PLM provides a unified cloud platform and digital thread needed to support the velocity and resiliency your new business models and innovations require.

Speakers

Kirk Carlsen

Director PLM Product Marketing

Kirk Carlsen is a Product Marketing Director for Product Lifecycle Management applications at Oracle. Kirk helps customers understand how they can successfully meet customer expectations with digitally transformative technologies that help drive product innovation and streamline commercialization.

Linkedin Kirk Carlsen

Linda Mitchell

Master Principal Solution Consultant

Linda is a SCM professional with over 20 years of experience helping companies reach their supply chain goals through leveraging technology. She has spent significant time focusing on improvements relating to new product introduction and development process.

Linkedin Linda Mitchell

Enhance the Perfect Delivery with IoT

March 24, 2021

Overview

Title: Enhance the Perfect Delivery with IoT

Date: March 24, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

IoT applications can enhance and strengthen the perfect delivery. They capture sensor data so you can monitor shipments for unforeseen issues or delays, gain real-time visibility into shipment locations and the condition of goods, and even predict the time of arrival for shipments. See how IoT works with supply chain logistics in this live demo.

Speakers

Simon Nicholson

Senior Director, Blockchain and IoT Applications Product Development

Simon Nicholson is Senior Director, Product Management for the Oracle Applications Development organization, focusing on Innovation including Internet of Things, AI/ML and Blockchain. He is responsible, globally, for go-to-market planning and execution. Prior to joining Oracle in 2010, Simon has worked on both sides of the Atlantic in leadership roles in the enterprise and mobile segments for Sun Microsystems and Xerox, including in executive roles for industry standards organizations including ebXML, the Liberty Alliance (now Kantara Initiative) and OASIS.

Linkedin Simon Nicholson

Nick Pesce

Lead Solution Engineer, Logistics and SCM Emerging Technologies

Nick Pesce is a lifelong Logistician. For the past 18+ years he has served in the United States Marine Corps. In 2015, Nick joined Oracle’s Logistics Cloud Team with expertise in Transportation and Global Trade Management, Logistics Network Modeling, Blockchain and IoT SaaS applications. He holds a certificate from MIT in Blockchain Technologies and a bachelor’s of science from Texas A&M University.

Linkedin Nick Pesce

Take the Uncertainty out of Global Trade Compliance

March 3, 2021

Overview

Title: Take the Uncertainty out of Global Trade Compliance

Date: March 3, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

Navigating changes in cross-border trade can get complicated—but the inability to adapt can lead to dire consequences. USMCA, Brexit, and COVID-19 are just a few developments impacting global trade. See how to keep goods moving and remain compliant with an integrated global trade and transportation platform.

Speakers

Joan Lim

Senior Manager, Product Marketing

Joan Lim leads product marketing for Oracle Cloud Logistics solutions, covering transportation, global trade, and warehouse management. Prior to Oracle, Joan held product marketing and strategy positions at Unilever, Qualcomm, Amadeus IT Group and various start-ups focusing on cloud applications and supply chain. Joan has a master’s degree in digital marketing strategy from Georgetown University, and a master’s degree in business from ESSCA Business School in France.

Linkedin Joan Lim

Harry Cao

Master Principal Solution Engineer, Oracle Cloud Logistics

Harry Cao joined Oracle through G-Log acquisition and has been successful in helping companies adopt modern logistics technologies for 18 years. When Oracle introduced Global Trade Management in 2010, Harry was the first solution engineer worldwide supporting the product launch. Since then, he has become the ambassador of Oracle’s Integrated Trade & Transportation platform and has always been on the forefront of new capabilities that helps companies solve supply chain challenges. Harry holds a degree in MBA in Logistics & Transportation from the University of Tennessee.

Linkedin Harry Cao

Adapt and Compete with a Data-First Strategy

February 24, 2021

Overview

Title: Adapt and Compete with a Data-First Strategy

Date: February 24, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

Today’s competitive companies have a data-first strategy that permeates their organizations. They’ve connected their business applications and synchronized enterprise data, such as product hierarchies, to create trust in the numbers. See firsthand how cloud enterprise data management capabilities such as data governance, change data visualization, and hierarchy management give supply chains the agility to adapt to change, faster.

Speakers

Emma Yu

Director of ERP/EPM Cloud Product Marketing

Emma has over 15 years of experience working in the enterprise software industry and highly focused on helping companies be more data-driven and agile. Working for 3VR, Planful and most recently Oracle, Emma has had roles in marketing strategy, partner and business development, demand generation, and product marketing. With a passion for EPM and EDM, Emma often contributes to thought leadership articles and speaks in webcasts on these topics.

Linkedin Emma Yu

Drew Wilson

Master Principal Sales Engineer, Oracle EPM/EDM SaaS

Drew Wilson has been with Oracle since 2006. In that time, he has implemented Oracle Data Management solutions before moving to the SE role in 2007 where he has worked with some of the largest and most complex organizations successfully solving their data management and alignment challenges. Prior to his Oracle tenure, he spent 11 years managing Accounting, Finance and Financial Systems organizations developing his passion for the importance of data as a valuable asset.

Linkedin Drew Wilson

Overcome Disruption with an Adaptive Logistics Network

February 17, 2021

Overview

Title: Overcome Disruption with an Adaptive Logistics Network

Date: February 17, 2021

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

Faced with rapid, unpredictable change, supply chains need to be adaptive–pivoting quickly to tackle the next new challenge. Advanced modeling solutions analyze what-if scenarios across your transportation and logistics networks, so you can make better, faster decisions. See ours in action.

Speakers

Joan Lim

Senior Manager, Product Marketing

Joan Lim leads product marketing for Oracle Cloud Logistics solutions, covering transportation, global trade, and warehouse management. Prior to Oracle, Joan held product marketing and strategy positions at Unilever, Qualcomm, Amadeus IT Group and various start-ups focusing on cloud applications and supply chain. Joan has a master’s degree in digital marketing strategy from Georgetown University, and a master’s degree in business from ESSCA Business School in France.

Linkedin Joan Lim

Vicky Spurlock

Senior Solution Engineer

Vicky is a seasoned information technology and logistics professional having 20 years of experience implementing Oracle Transportation Management Software. Implementations have included both on-premise and cloud solutions for 3PL, retail, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, and supplier clients. She has worked closely with our development team to build out scenarios for the Logistics Network Modeling tool and looks forward to demonstrating their powerful capabilities.

Linkedin Vicky Spurlock

Optimize Omnichannel Order Management and Fulfillment

February 3, 2021

Achieving Multitier Visibility in Supply Chains

October 7, 2020

Orchestrate Change, Incorporate Insights, and Move Toward Continuous Supply Chain Planning

October 21, 2020

Overview

Title: Orchestrate Change, Incorporate Insights, and Move Toward Continuous Supply Chain Planning

Date: November 21, 2020

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

Uniting planning across functions to move towards a continuous planning model with connected enterprise planning has never been more critical. Evolving business practices and technology are making it increasingly important to update and improve plans with new and relevant inputs. Monthly S&OP cycles are giving way to continuous planning, managed in tighter time frames and, driving improved performance throughout the material and financial supply chain.

In this session, you will get to see firsthand how new technologies like machine learning and big data management applications in both demand and supply planning are helping planners to proactively identify plan shortcomings and resolve gaps for better planning results, faster.

Speakers

Tom McDonough

Senior Director of Product Marketing

Tom has worked in supply chain management for over 25 years, leading supply chain functions in the high tech industry at Technicolor and Intel and supply chain consulting services in media & communications, consumer goods and retail industries.

Linkedin Tom McDonough

Derek Rutherford

Principal Solution Engineer

Derek has worked in the supply chain space for over 25 years, including experience in High-Tech, Industrial Manufacturing, Oil & Gas and the Military. He has designed supply chain management processes and solutions, and implemented them at multiple Fortune 500 companies. He currently works with many of Oracle’s largest customers to help with their supply chain transformations.

Linkedin Derek Rutherford

Drive Faster, Better Decision Making with Unified Machine, Product, Operational, and Customer Data

November 4, 2020

Overview

Title: Drive Faster, Better Decision Making with Unified Machine, Product, Operational, and Customer Data

Date: November 4, 2020

Start Time: Available on-demand

Duration: 30 mins

Description

Making tactical and strategic decisions has never been more important. That’s why it’s essential to have a complete view of all the data you need to make informed decisions about everything from your product innovation to how much to make and where to do it. This session will focus on the importance of creating this unified digital thread and key considerations for speeding and improving decision quality.

Speakers

John Barcus

Group VP of Manufacturing Industries

John has been with Oracle for over 20 years, 8 of which were in consulting working with customers to manage large global ERP and advanced planning projects. John brings to companies a strong manufacturing, supply chain, and industry background. His implementation and business experiences help customers to use technology to solve business issues, gain competitive advantage, and to adapt to the rapidly evolving needs of the digital age. John has been a frequent speaker at industry events.

Linkedin John Barcus

Dan Murphy

Principal Sales Engineer

Dan is a Solutions Engineer with the Strategic Services Team. He works with Oracle’s largest customers to modernize and automate their Supply Chain Management systems. For the past 5 years, Dan has had a laser focus on Cloud Manufacturing, Costing, Maintenance, IOT and AI applications. Prior to the Cloud Applications, he spent 10 years working with Oracle’s largest customers on EBS Manufacturing & PLM applications. Before joining the Technology space, he worked in four various manufacturing companies as a planner, scheduler, and materials manager implementing and using different ERP Software Applications.

Linkedin Dan Murphy

Integrate Financial and Operational Planning

November 18, 2020

Overview

Title: Integrate Financial and Operational Planning

Date: November 18, 2020

Start Time: 1:00 p.m. CT

Duration: 30 mins

Description

How do you put your plans into action? Connected business planning across finance and supply chain can help you be agile, act quickly, and pivot to new business models.

Let us show you how connecting Scenario and Supply Chain Planning in the Oracle Cloud can move your business forward.

Speakers

Marc Seewald

Vice President, EPM Product Management

Marc Seewald is a vice president of EPM Product Management at Oracle, and has 20+ years of experience in Enterprise Performance Management (EPM). He has in-depth experience across the financial close, FP&A, and tax reporting domains, and has worked with numerous Global 2000 companies. Marc joined Oracle 8+ years ago and leads multiple product lines within Oracle EPM. Prior to joining Oracle, he was vice president of product management at Longview Solutions – a North American-based EPM software company.

Linkedin Marc Seewald

Enrique Lopez-Tello

VP of Manufacturing & Hi Tech Industries

Enrique has hold management positions in global companies that develop and commercialize high technology solutions and services during the last 25 years (software, hardware and networks). He developed his career in Asia, North America and Europe. During the last 13 years Enrique helped defining and implementing Oracle’s Global offering as Industry Solutions provider with a more recent focus on IoT, Big Data & AI emerging technologies used by G2000 organizations. Before Oracle, he held senior management positions in the area of Services, Supply Chain and Manufacturing at AT&T, Lucent Technologies, Telefonica, Agere and Indra.

Linkedin Enrique Lopez-Tello

Colton Bretschneider

EPM Solutions Engineer

Colton Bretschneider is an EPM Solutions Engineer specializing in the Higher Education & Healthcare industries. Before working at Oracle, he worked in reimbursement consulting at Plante Moran, and is a graduate from Michigan State University with a degree in Accounting.

Linkedin Colton Bretschneider
